page.title: 06Education in Yelden
page.content: North Bedfordshire now has a three tier system of Lower, Middle and Upper schools. The Yelden village school is no longer in existence. The children are bused out of the village to Riseley Lower School.(which is a church school of about 120 children) or they may attend Eileen Wade School at Upper Dean (which has about 20 children) At the age of 9 they transfer to Margaret Beaufort at Riseley and at 13 they attend Sharnbrook Upper School. If parents do not want to use the State system and are prepared to pay and to transport their own children there are a number of private schools to choose from in Bedford,Kimbolton and Wellingborough. There is a Playgroup at Pertenhall which runs twice a week and a mums and tots morning for under 3's.
